description: Application under Section 73 of the Town and Country Planning Act for a variation of Condition 12 (Sustainability Standards) of Planning Permission 15/12280/FUL (Redevelopment of site and erection of part 4, part 5 storey building to provide 26 residential units)
decision_conditions: The development  which has been constructed and occupied shall be maintained in accordance with the detailed drawings approved under reference 15/12280/FUL, and as subsequently varied by 16/12058/NMA and 16/12244/NMA.Reason: For avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning

Within 3 months from the date of this permission, written confirmation from the developer should be submitted and approved by the local planning authority to ensure that the water appliances/fittings have been installed as specified at the design stage.Within 3 months from the date of this permission, the  shortfall  in carbon emissions identified the Thermal Bridge Report (assessed against building regulations 2013 part L output documents)  shall have been  provided via a cash in lieu contribution (based on a carbon offset tariff of Â£60/tonne, as set out in The London Plan 2011).Reason: In the interests of sustainability and energy conservation in accordance with Policies SI 2 of the London Plan (2021) and Policy DM1 (Sustainable Design and Construction Standards) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The development which has been built shall be maintained in accordance with the details approved under condition discharge 16/12592/COND: Submission of details pursuant to Condition 9 (Details, including materials), Condition 10 (Piling Method Statement) and Condition 14 (Surface Water Drainage Scheme) of planning ref: 15/12280/FUL.Reason: To ensure satisfactory completion of the development, in accordance with policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The development shall be retained in accordance with the details approved as part of  discharge of conditions  16/12230/COND: Details required by Conditions 4 (Lifetime Homes), 5 (Levels), 6 (Construction Management Plan),  12 (parts i, ii, and iii) (Water Efficiency) of planning ref:15/12280/FUL.Reason: To ensure satisfactory completion of the development, in accordance with policy DM10 of the LDF Core Strategy 2012.

The development which has been built and completed shall be retained in accordance with the acoustic insulation details (Condition 13 of planning ref: 15/12280/FUL)  approved under condition discharge 16/122965/COND and thereafter permanently retained.Reason: In order to control the noise emanating there from and in the interests of the residential amenities of the area in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The development shall be maintained in accordance with the detailed landscaping scheme approved under condition discharge 16/12875/COND (Planning Condition 7 of 15/12280/FUL) as subsequently varied by ref: 16/12563/NMA.The tree planting and landscaping shall thereafter be maintained for five years, from the date of completion of the development approved under  ref: 15/12280/FUL, (building completed March 2018), to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority. Any trees or shrubs which die during this period shall be replaced in the first available planting season, and the area shown to be landscaped shall be permanently retained for that purpose only.Reason: In the interests of visual amenity and also that the Local Planning Authority shall be satisfied as to the details of the development in accordance with Policy DM10 (Design Requirements for New Developments including House Extensions) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.

The cycle parking facilities approved under 17/12070/COND (Condition 3 of planning ref: 15/12280/FUL) shall be provided in accordance with the approved details, and  made available for use at all times for use by residents of the development and shall thereafter be  permanently retained.Reason: To ensure the provision of satisfactory cycle storage facilities and in the interests of highway safety in accordance with Policy DM8 (Sustainable Transport for New Developments) of the LDF Core Strategy Adopted April 2012.
